articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: U.S. confirms 15th case of coronavirus
articles.description: With a spike in the number of coronavirus cases, the CDC warns the deadly outbreak could continue into next year. There are at least 15 cases in the U.S. Carter Evans has the latest.

articles.author: Sophie Lewis
articles.title: A florist is selling anti-coronavirus bouquets for Valentine's Day
articles.description: The bouquets include sanitizer, soap, and a mask and gloves.
articles.content: A florist in the Philippines is selling romance and practicality this Valentine's Day with a bouquet of flowers that comes with anti-coronavirus gear. The innovative gift – which includes sanitizer, soap and a mask and gloves – is proving popular among local … [+1753 chars]

articles.author: Caitlin O'Kane
articles.title: How soon can scientists find a coronavirus vaccine?
articles.description: Drug companies and labs worldwide are scrambling to come up with a vaccine to stop the deadly new virus.
articles.content: Researchers at a San Diego lab say it took them just three hours to come up with an experimental vaccine for the coronavirus — a potential weapon against the illness which has infected at least 60,000 people worldwide to date. Inovio Pharmaceuticals is now sc… [+4643 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Stock rally fizzles as virus cases spike
articles.description: Shares opened lower on Thursday after China reported new cases, increasing worries about the economic impact.
articles.content:
U.S. stocks fell in early trading Thursday as China reported a spike in cases of the new virus that threatens to crimp economic growth and hurt businesses worldwide.
The S&P 500 index fell 0.4% as of 10 a.m. Eastern time. The Dow Jones Industrial Average… [+2149 chars]

articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.title: Coronavirus chills luxury brands in — and outside — China
articles.description: Brands such as Gucci, Burberry and LVMH are hurting as Chinese consumers — vital to the upscale market — stay home.
articles.content: The deadly coronavirus outbreak paralyzing China is taking a toll on luxury goods companies. The latest player to feel the chill is Kering Group, which owns Balenciaga, Gucci and other upscale fashion brands and which on Wednesday announced that it has closed… [+4529 chars]

articles.title: How the coronavirus is impacting the global economy

articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 02/13
articles.description: A spike in coronavirus cases in China. President Trump doubles down on Roger Stone's punishment. Getting injured soldiers back in uniform. CBS News Correspondent Steve Kathan has today's World News Roundup.
